thread.title: This Week in Michigan Football: UM at Maryland - MGoBlue
thread.title_full: This Week in Michigan Football: UM at Maryland - MGoBlue

title: This Week in Michigan Football: UM at Maryland - MGoBlue
text:
Recap | Box Score | Notes | Quotes | 
BIG TEN OPENERS 
 Michigan has won eight of its last nine Big Ten openers and 31 of its 33 conference openers. The Wolverines boast an impressive 48-12-2 mark since 1953 in their first Big Ten game of the season. 
 The Wolverines will play their 110th conference opener Saturday at Maryland. 
 U-M has compiled an 82-25-2 record in conference openers and has claimed victories in 44 of its last 47 Big Ten openers. 
 Michigan had a 23-game winning streak in conference openers snapped at Wisconsin (23- 20) in 2005. 
 The only setbacks in the past 47 Big Ten openers came on the road against the Badgers (21-14 in 1981 and 23-20 in 2005) and last season at home against Minnesota (30-14 in 2014). 
CONFERENCE OPENERS ON THE ROAD 
 U-M will look for its 30th victory in Big Ten openers on the road when it faces Maryland. 
 This will be U-M's 42nd conference opener on the road. 
CONFERENCE OPENERS VS. MARYLAND 
 Maryland becomes the 11th different Big Ten school that U-M will face in a conference opener. 
 Recent members Nebraska and Rutgers are the only schools that the Wolverines have not faced in a Big Ten opener. 
MARYLAND SERIES 
 This will be the fifth meeting between Michigan and Maryland. 
 Michigan won three of the four games played between the two schools. 
 The Wolverines are making their first-ever visit to Maryland on Saturday. 
 Michigan won the first three games played between the two schools, all non-conference affairs at the Big House (20-0 in 1985, 41-21 in 1989 and 45-17 in 1990). 
 The Terrapins earned a victory in the first game played as Big Ten foes, earning a 23-16 win at Michigan Stadium in 2014. 
OFFENSE 
 The offense has been balanced through four games, with the ground game gaining 202.2 yards per contest and the air attack averaging 194 yards per game. 
 Michigan needs 191 rushing yards to reach 1,000 yards on the season. U-M has rushed 167 times for 809 yards and 10 touchdowns. 
 Six different Wolverines have scored rushing touchdowns this season, led by tailback De'Veon Smith (4) and quarterback Jake Rudock (2). 
 In the passing game, Michigan needs 223 yards to reach 1,000 on the year. U-M has completed 73-of-119 (61.3 pct.) for 776 yards and four touchdowns. 
 U-M has won the time of possession battle in each of the four contests this season and has nearly a 10-minute advantage on the opposition (34:21 to 25:39). 
 Michigan's offensive line has allowed three sacks in four games. The front did not yield a sack at Utah or against UNLV and allowed one sack vs. Oregon State and two against BYU. 
 The offense has converted 13-of-14 red-zone chances this season. U-M has scored 11 touchdowns and two field goals. The Wolverines scored four rushing touchdowns and converted one field goal against Oregon State after tallying two passing touchdowns and one field goal at Utah. Michigan scored one rushing and one passing TD against UNLV. U-M went 3-for-4 against BYU, scoring three touchdowns. 
 The Wolverines are converting 46 percent of their third-down chances (27-of-59) and have moved the chains on 2-of-7 fourth-down opportunities. 
 Michigan has lined up with the same five starters along the offensive line in each of the first four games. 
DEFENSE 
 The U-M defense is allowing just 82 yards per contest rushing and 121.8 yards passing. 
 The Wolverines have yielded 38 points on the season (9.5 avg.). 
 Michigan has been stout on third down, allowing just 13 conversions in 54 attempts through three games (24%). 
 The defense has eight sacks and 32 TFLs through four games of action. 
 U-M posted 10 stops behind the line of scrimmage at Utah, added seven TFLs vs. Oregon State, posted nine against UNLV and added six TFLs against BYU. 
 Michigan has 13 different players with 10 or more stops this season, with four other contributors within a stop of reaching double digits. 
 Michigan has held the opposition scoreless in 10 of the last 12 quarters. 
 The defense has yielded just seven points over the last 11 quarters. 
 U-M forced eight three-and-outs by BYU in 12 drives. 
 The Wolverines have forced four turnovers on the season; Jeremy Clark recorded interceptions against Utah and UNLV, Joe Bolden snagged a fumble recovery against Oregon State, and Channing Stribling had a pick vs. UNLV. 
 The defense has batted down 13 passes in four games, led by cornerback Jourdan Lewis' six PBUs. 
 Michigan has allowed the opposition six red-zone chances, with three coming in the Utah game, one against Oregon State and two by UNLV; two of the six red-zone opportunities came on the opening possession of the Utah and OSU games. 
 The defense held the opposition to less than 100 rushing yards the past three games. 
 The defense has held the opposition to less than 100 yards passing twice this season: 79 yards vs. Oregon State and 55 yards vs. BYU. 
 U-M's defense has three veteran linebackers -- Joe Bolden , Desmond Morgan and James Ross -- with a combined 73 starts and 115 games of experience. 
 Bolden and Ross have been named Butkus Award candidates for the 2015 season, and Bolden was additionally named a candidate for the Lott IMPACT Trophy. 
 Morgan was nominated for the National Football Foundation and College Football Hall of Fame Scholar-Athlete award. 
 After only appearing in one game last year, Desmond Morgan has returned to form in 2015. The fifth-year senior has a team-leading 250 tackles during his career with 16 TFLs. 
SPECIAL TEAMS 
 U-M has converted 4-of-5 field goals and all 13 PATs. 
 Michigan has not registered a touchback in 15 punts this season. 
 The Wolverines are averaging 40.9 yards per punt with seven being fair caught and nine inside the opposition's 20-yard line. 
 The kickoff unit has 11 touchbacks in 22 kickoffs; the opposition is averaging just 15.7 yards per return (9 returns for 141 yards). 
 The lone returning starter on special teams is long snapper Scott Sypniewski . 
Learn about individual game tickets for the 2015 Michigan football season .
